DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate safety feasibility non-invasive magnetic stimulation posterior tibial nerve use EMKinetics LoFIT Pulse System treat patient document overactive bladder .
DOC.brief_title: A Clinical Study Magnetic Stimulation Posterior Tibial Nerve Overactive Bladder
DOC.criteria: Women > 18 year age A score > 4 OABq short form urgency ( question 1 ) Average urinary frequency > 10 time one 24 hour day base 3day void diary Selfreported bladder symptom present > 3 month Selfreported fail conservative care ( e.g. , dietary restriction , fluid restriction , bladder training , behavioral modification , pelvic muscle training , biofeedback , etc . ) use antimuscarinics . Off antimuscarinics least 2 week prior enrollment Capable give informed consent Ambulatory able use toilet independently , without difficulty Capable willing follow studyrelated procedure The patient pregnant intend become pregnant course study . ( Patients become pregnant course study immediately terminate study . ) The patient active urinary tract infection . Neurogenic bladder Botox use bladder pelvic floor muscle past year Pacemakers implantable defibrillator Primary complaint stress urinary incontinence Current vaginal infection Current use InterStim Current use Bion Current use TENS pelvic region , back leg Previously treat PTNS Use investigational drug/device therapy within past 4 week Participating participate within past 4 week clinical investigation involve impact gynecologic , urinary renal function Deemed unsuitable enrollment study investigator base subject ' history physical examination The patient metal implant surgery metallic foreign body either leg ( distal ) knee ( permanent metallic tattoo < 30cm leave ankle ) . The patient chronic constipation ( less two ( 2 ) bowel movement per week ) The patient history gastric urinary retention The patient uncontrolled diabetes Subjects nerve damage , injury surgery would impact either tibial nerve pelvic floor function The patient unable unwilling sign inform consent The patient currently pharmacologic treatment could affect bladder function Known Cystocele > /= Grade 3 reduce treatment ( surgery pessary )
